intro: Crotalaria keilii f. chevalieri, commonly known as the chevalier's crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of many species in the Crotalaria genus. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It is often found in grassland habitats and can be a component of natural vegetation in arid and semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
